achievement.doc: Gives a player an achievement or increases a statistic.

arg3.name: [player]
arg3.doc: Must be a player name or a target selector. If not specified, defaults to the command's executor. Not optional in command blocks.

p1.name: @p
p1.doc: Targets the nearest player. If there are multiple nearest players, caused by them being precisely the same distance away, the player who most recently joined the server is selected.

p2.name: @r
p2.doc: Targets a random player (or entity with the type target selector argument).

p3.name: @a
p3.doc: Targets all players, including dead players. No other selector will find dead players.

ban.doc: Adds a player to the blacklist.

arg1.name: <name>
arg1.doc: The name of the player to be banned. Does not need to be online, or even real.

arg2.name: [reason ...]
arg2.doc: Text to be displayed with the ban, to other operators and in the server logs.

ban-ip.doc: Adds an IP address to the blacklist.

arg1.name: <address|name>
arg1.doc: An IP address or the name of a player who is currently online

arg2.name: [reason ...]
arg2.doc: Text to be displayed with the ban, to other operators and in the server logs.

blockdata.doc: Modifies the data tag of a block

arg1.name: <x>
arg1.doc: Specifies the coordinates of the block to be modified. May be provided in tilde notation to identify a position relative to the command's execution.

arg2.name: <y>
arg2.doc: Specifies the coordinates of the block to be modified. May be provided in tilde notation to identify a position relative to the command's execution.

arg3.name: <z>
arg3.doc: Specifies the coordinates of the block to be modified. May be provided in tilde notation to identify a position relative to the command's execution.

arg4.name: <dataTag>
arg4.doc: Specifies the data tag elements to be added to, or overwrite elements of, the specified block. Must be a compound NBT tag.

execute.doc: Executes a command on behalf of one or more other entities, with originating permissions.

arg1.name: <entity>
arg1.doc: Specifies the target to be the command's executor. Must be a player name or target selector. If more than one entity is selected, the command will be run once as each of them.

p1.name: @p
p1.doc: Targets the nearest player. If there are multiple nearest players, caused by them being precisely the same distance away, the player who most recently joined the server is selected.

p2.name: @r
p2.doc: Targets a random player (or entity with the type target selector argument).

p3.name: @a
p3.doc: Targets all players, including dead players. No other selector will find dead players.

arg5.name: <detect|command ...>
arg5.doc: on condition that a single-block /testforblock-style check passes. Specifies the command to be run. Must be a valid command.

arg6.name: <x2>
arg6.doc: Specifies the position of the block to check. Must be within the range -30,000,000 to 30,000,000 (inclusive). May use tilde notation to specify distances relative to x.

arg7.name: <y2>
arg7.doc: Specifies the position of the block to check. May use tilde notation to specify distances relative to y.

arg8.name: <z2>
arg8.doc: Specifies the position of the block to check. Must be within the range -30,000,000 to 30,000,000 (inclusive). May use tilde notation to specify distances relative to z.

arg9.name: <block>
arg9.doc: Specifies the block id and data which the block at (x2,y2,z2) must match for the command to run. block must be a valid block id.

arg10.name: <data>
arg10.doc: Must be a valid block data for that type of block or -1 to match any block data.

arg11.name: <command ...>
arg11.doc: Specifies the command to be run. Must be a valid command.

p2.name: achievement.acquireIron
p2.doc: Acquire Hardware - Smelt an iron ingot

p3.name: achievement.bakeCake
p3.doc: The Lie - Wheat, sugar, milk, and eggs

p4.name: achievement.blazeRod
p4.doc: Into Fire - Relieve a Blaze of its rod

p5.name: achievement.bookcase
p5.doc: Librarian - Build some bookshelves to improve your enchantment table

p6.name: achievement.breedCow
p6.doc: Repopulation - Breed two cows with wheat

p7.name: achievement.buildBetterPickaxe
p7.doc: Getting an Upgrade - Construct a better pickaxe

p8.name: achievement.buildFurnace
p8.doc: Hot Topic - Construct a furnace out of eight cobblestone blocks

p9.name: achievement.buildHoe
p9.doc: Time to Farm! - Use planks and sticks to make a hoe

p10.name: achievement.buildPickaxe
p10.doc: Time to Mine! - Use planks and sticks to make a pickaxe

p11.name: achievement.buildSword
p11.doc: Time to Strike! - Use planks and sticks to make a sword

p12.name: achievement.buildWorkBench
p12.doc: Benchmarking - Craft a workbench with four blocks of planks

p13.name: achievement.cookFish
p13.doc: Delicious Fish - Catch and cook a fish!

p14.name: achievement.diamonds
p14.doc: DIAMONDS! - Acquire diamonds with your iron tools

p15.name: achievement.diamondsToYou
p15.doc: Diamonds to you! - Throw diamonds at another player

p16.name: achievement.enchantments
p16.doc: Enchanter - Use a book, obsidian and diamonds to construct an enchantment table

p18.name: achievement.flyPig
p18.doc: When Pigs Fly - Fly a pig off a cliff

p20.name: achievement.ghast
p20.doc: Return to Sender - Destroy a Ghast with a fireball

p22.name: achievement.killEnemy
p22.doc: Monster Hunter - Attack and destroy a monster

p24.name: achievement.makeBread
p24.doc: Bake Bread - Turn wheat into bread

p25.name: achievement.mineWood
p25.doc: Getting Wood - Attack a tree until a block of wood pops out

p26.name: achievement.onARail
p26.doc: On A Rail - Travel by minecart at least 1 km from where you started

p27.name: achievement.openInventory
p27.doc: Taking Inventory - Press \'E\' to open your inventory

p28.name: achievement.overkill
p28.doc: Overkill - Deal nine hearts of damage in a single hit

p30.name: achievement.portal
p30.doc: We Need to Go Deeper - Build a portal to the Nether

p32.name: achievement.snipeSkeleton
p32.doc: Sniper Duel - Kill a skeleton with an arrow from more than 50 meters

p35.name: achievement.theEnd2
p35.doc: The End. - Defeat the Ender Dragon

p1.name: minecraft:air
p1.doc: Air is the block present in otherwise empty space.

p2.name: minecraft:stone
p2.doc: Stone is a block found in abundance in the Overworld.
